review_title: An opportunity to be part of something bigger
pros:
CIFF provides the opportunity to contribute to the improvement of children's lives around the world, which is not something many organisations can say. It is not your usual charitable organisation and operates with a more commercial focus, viewing programes as investments.
	
It is a challenging, yet very rewarding organisation to work for. Expectations are high, but high performers and passionate people do very well.
Very competitive salary and great benefits.
cons:
A relatively young organisation, CIFF has growing pains at times. In some areas it lacks the processes and procedures you might find in a more established organisation, however it has come a long way in the last couple of years.
	
Being a demanding organisation, this can take its toll on ones worklife balance, however this is something that can be managed once you are here and settled into your role.

pros: One of the largest philanthropic funders of support to the developing world, focused on children's survival and development.
cons: Great organisation, with great entrepreneurial spirit to innovate, travel and have an impact on the world.  The expertise and drive of employees at CIFF are second to none with a wealth of experience.  A real opportunity to share knowledge and learn.

pros: One of the UK's largest foundations huge potential & excellent staff working on a wide range of issues affecting children in developing countries,  willing to innovate and back novel interventions and create long term partnerships.
cons: Going through transition & and organisational change process which creates uncertainty and delays for grantees and for staff
